sourceMeaningMnemonic: You take some <radical>thread</radical>, put your <radical>scooter</radical> up to a <radical>signpost</radical>, and <kanji>sew</kanji> them together. You don't have a lock, so sewing your scooter up to the signpost to keep it safe is all you can think of.
meaningInfo: Imagine slowly sewing your scooter to the signpost, passing the thread back and forth through the signpost's metal holes and your scooter's handles.
readingMnemonic: You usually only <kanji>sew</kanji> at <reading>ho</reading>me (<ja>ほう</ja>), so this is a big exception for you. You're usually worried that if you sew in public people will judge your stitches, so this is a big step for you!
readingInfo: Hopefully, if your scooter is still here later you'll be able to start sewing outside of your home more often from now on!
